definition: at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: The teacher came striding into the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 老師大步流星地走進教室。

sentences.english: He walked along the path with great strides.
sentences.chinese: 他在這條小路上大步流星地走着。

sentences.english: The Badger strode heavily into the room.
sentences.chinese: 獾大步流星地跨進房間。

sentences.english: The manager strode rapidly down the street.
sentences.chinese: 經理大步流星地從街上走過。

definition: in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
with one's hands clasped behind one's back
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
